post.body: @KerryMG Oh you're just saying that cos you heart Kate Bush. Btw thanks for the payment for the bass amp.
Oooh, nice idea but not sure I'd want to supply my password. Why do they need that?
@PBizzle PBizzle's avatar is pretty rubbish, don't you think?
Well at least mine is creative, it's not just a second-rate photoshop of an ill-looking llama. And not even the full lama.
It's not bad. I can't really say whose is the worst avatar without causing a fuss.
Could I? I mean, can you? Hmm, I'll have to look into that. Could be strangely appropriate given my general approach to life
My advice to you is to start drinking heavily.
I'll see your "Fairytale Of New York" and raise you "So This Is Christmas"
Why don't you make your own mince pies? You just need mincemeat. Make sure you use the right sort though.
Try and redress the balance with the best Chrimbo song ever - "Can You Stop The Cavalry."
I think you'll find mince pies are worth 20 miles. There is nothing better than a good mince pie.
I was looking for polls last month, so at least one month ago.
Yes, but I've got a ringing noise in my ears now - oh, it's the phone, hang on...
Not sure what it has to do with guy, but thanks anyway! :)
@OwenC @PBizzle Outstanding. Thanks all of you! Feel much better now... :) :) :)
Or Rufus Wainwright or Leonard Cohen. Or others: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hallelujah_(Leonard_Cohen_song)#Other_cover_versions
An Englishman never loses the cricket. The cricket loses him. (no, I don't know what this means either).
... you'd have three quid?
If you were displaying them *down* to the knee you'd be colder.
It's actually quite a serious insult, yes. Remember the pic of Tony Blair and Gaddafi? http://tinyurl.com/556492
Yeah, usually do. In fact, probably did. I'm a compulsive CTRL-S man.
Great, thanks! :)
Call it Powernapping. They'll think it's a PR thing.
Judicious use of the direct message there. One of these days I'm going to get that badly wrong.
I can believe that. They do sap one's life essence don't they?
Aren't most subs submerged most of the time?
Surely working *in* submarines would be less hazardous?
'The Box' on the BBC. I know the PR people behind it - what an incredible sell-in. #proty
I think it's pre-apocalyptic?
@timhoang It's a *really* good piece of work. Congratulations in order.
Shared: Twitter - Part 2 | Tech PR Gems - The Topaz Partners Blog: I totally understand the problem Paul .. http://tinyurl.com/6obmyf
Kings of Leon rocked. There were also VERY loud. The O2 arena is VERY loud.

Someone tell me a joke, I need cheering up.
Looking forward to Kings of Leon. Eighteen balding star? Forty balding social media guy!

Shared: Why Brands ABSOLUTELY DO Belong on Twitter: 'Brands have personalities too' - so basic .. http://tinyurl.com/66achs
So, it turns out the local BT exchange is knackered. I cannot get broadband for at least a month. Grrrrr.
Praise Be to Word's recovery feature. I didn't lose everything. :)
Got in early to get stuff done, PC just crashed, lost the whole lot. :(
Decided I no longer hate Virgin Media. I now hate BT.
So I guess spending 3 days with a headache and stomachache isn't right. In work this morning but may not be for the full day.

Funny. I used to be a designer so people ask me to 'do' design. Copywriter? 'Do' some words. Perhaps I shouldn't own up to these things?

Make that six.
I just ate five dark chocolate ginger biscuits and now I feel really great but also quite sick.
Stats on how/how many students in the UK use social media, please, anyone?
My workload today? Four Seasons In One Day. How would you sum yours up, via the medium of song? Bat Out Of Hell? Long And Winding Road?

How much busier could I be? None. None more busy.
